function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Global connectivity and trade promote the use of cheap and long-distance transportation, increasing the risk of contagious diseases spreading globally.","Impact":"Increased risk of widespread contagious disease propagation and disruption of supply chains.","Mitigation":"Investment in local production, diversified sourcing, and stringent health and safety protocols for transportation.","Technologies":"Blockchain for supply chain transparency, automated health screening at transportation hubs.","People":"Global population, especially individuals involved in international trade and transportation.","Owner":"Government, international organizations, and businesses involved in global trade."},{"Description":"Restricted mobility and economic activity during the COVID-19 crisis led to improved air quality but uncertain impact on climate change and biodiversity conservation.","Impact":"Uncertain long-term impact on climate change, potential creation of black markets for wildlife products, and challenges for conservation efforts.","Mitigation":"Stricter regulations on wildlife products, sustainable tourism development, and support for conservation enforcement in developing countries.","Technologies":"Digital monitoring of wildlife trade, sustainable tourism technologies, and remote sensing for conservation monitoring.","People":"Global population, wildlife conservation organizations, and local communities in biodiversity hotspots.","Owner":"Governments, conservation organizations, and tourism industry stakeholders."},{"Description":"Drop in greenhouse gas emissions during lockdowns, driven by reduced transportation and energy demand, drew attention.","Impact":"Potential rebound of emissions post-lockdown and challenges in sustaining reduced emissions.","Mitigation":"Investment in sustainable infrastructure, renewable energy, and promotion of telecommuting and remote work.","Technologies":"Renewable energy technologies, telecommuting platforms, and smart infrastructure for energy efficiency.","People":"Global population, businesses, and government organizations.","Owner":"Energy sector, environmental organizations, and government bodies."}]}
